property.name: text
property.value:
A simple demo for the UDPSocket accessor.
NOTE: This socket listens on the specified port and outputs any packet received on that port. The received packets will appear in the display ReceivedUDPPackets. To send UDP packets to the port to which this accessor is listening , there is a Node.js program which sends one packet each execution in the same demo directory, namely, UDPPacketGen.js. You can run this program as follows: > node UDPPacketGen.js after running this demo.

property.name: script
description
property.value: UDP socket accessor. This accessor listens to the UDP port, and outputs whatever arrives as a string. When a message arrives on the 'send' input, that message is sent over the socket.

property.name: port (port)
property.value: The port to use for the socket.
